entry.title: Meeting 2 assignment
entry.content:
Before 8am on Thursday, August 29, please do the following:

  • Review the discussion on first-species counterpoint from Wednesday’s class on Piazza.
  • Read the resource on Composing a first-species counterpoint, and watch the video at the end.
  • Log on to Learning Catalytics, use session ID 632054, and take the short quiz.

Notes on the quiz:
All quizzes in this course are open-note. You are also encouraged to talk to each other, in person or on Piazza, as you work on this quiz. However, be sure that the short-answer responses are 1) short (!), and 2) in your own words.

Since we have a day off on Monday, be sure to review the reading and your quiz responses (and any feedback I send you) before class next Wednesday.

Be sure to bring manuscript paper and a pencil, or a laptop/tablet with music notation software. (I highly recommend MuseScore, NoteFlight, and Lilypond—all free, all with different strengths.)

If you have any questions, please ask them on Piazza.

entry.title: Meeting 1 assignment
entry.content:
Before our next meeting (Wednesday, Aug. 28), sign up for Learning Catalytics and Piazza (if you didn’t already). Also, read the following resources: introduction to strict voice-leading and composing a cantus firmus.

Please make use of Piazza, rather than emailing me directly, if you have any questions about the reading, the course, the syllabus, the policies, the homework, or the technology.

entry.title: For Monday, August 26 (first meeting)
entry.content:
Welcome (back) to Boulder!

Before our first meeting, please read the syllabus, assessment, coursework, and policies pages for this course, as well as the Unit I guide. Note any questions you have about these documents.

Also, please bring a web-enabled device to class, such as a smartphone, tablet, or laptop.

I look forward to meeting all of you on Monday!

entry.title: Piazza
entry.content:
This term we will be using Piazza for class discussion. The system is highly catered to getting you help fast and efficiently from classmates and myself. Rather than emailing questions about course materials directly to me, I encourage you to post your questions on Piazza. If you have any problems or feedback for the developers, email team@piazza.com.

Of course, matters of a private nature should not be addressed on Piazza. Please email me about private concerns, or better yet, come by my office so we can discuss them in person.

Find our class Piazza page at: https://piazza.com/colorado/fall2013/musc2101001/home.
